channel.title: Joe Buhlig
channel.description: leverage the digital and welcome real life

item.title: 32: Can You Code On The iPad?
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe is trying to figure out if an iPad is worth it. Josh is doing well at HPS Grad School. Also, you should join the Guild.
item.content:encoded: Joe is trying to figure out if an iPad is worth it. Josh is doing well at HPS Grad School. Also, you should join the Guild.

item.title: 39: The 4 Disciplines of Execution by Chris McChesney, Jim Huling, Sean Covey
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: This round we learn why Mike doesn’t care for this book. Joe picked it only because it’s been popular and it was a listener recommendation. But that doesn’t affect their ratings at all.
item.content:encoded: This round we learn why Mike doesn’t care for this book. Joe picked it only because it’s been popular and it was a listener recommendation. But that doesn’t affect their ratings at all.

item.title: 15: All for a Space Gray Keyboard
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Right before recording, Drew took a look at his Mac’s desktop. This prompted some discussion. Also, a home automation talk. Joe’s not a fan.
item.content:encoded: Right before recording, Drew took a look at his Mac’s desktop. This prompted some discussion. Also, a home automation talk. Joe’s not a fan.

item.title: 31: Building A New Goal
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe dropped an atom bomb on his first goal. But what did he replace it with? And why make a big change this late in the game? But wait, how did he examine this new idea and get this far with it so quickly?
item.content:encoded: Joe dropped an atom bomb on his first goal. But what did he replace it with? And why make a big change this late in the game? But wait, how did he examine this new idea and get this far with it so quickly?

item.title: 14: A New Toy
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: It’s new iPhone season and Joe and Drew both found themselves upgrading to the X. So, what would a technology podcast be without a discussion about home screens?
item.content:encoded: It’s new iPhone season and Joe and Drew both found themselves upgrading to the X. So, what would a technology podcast be without a discussion about home screens?

item.title: 37: Antifragile by Nassim Nicholas Taleb
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Is it possible that attempting to break a thing can make it genuinely stronger? Also, Mike is back on OmniFocus. Who knew?
item.content:encoded: Is it possible that attempting to break a thing can make it genuinely stronger? Also, Mike is back on OmniFocus. Who knew?

item.title: 13: Decreasing in Searchability, Increasing in Awesomeness
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe continues delving into the world of podcasting equipment, Drew continues to delve into the world of paper. More conversation on switching from digital to analog tools, and the many uses of whiteboards.
item.content:encoded: Joe continues delving into the world of podcasting equipment, Drew continues to delve into the world of paper. More conversation on switching from digital to analog tools, and the many uses of whiteboards.

item.title: Building Communities That Help Your Small Business Thrive - SPRH Podcast
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: This was a really fun show I did with Matt Ward and Dan Candell over on the Square Peg Round Hole Podcast. We get to talk about building online communities (in my case Productivity Guild) and how those compare to FaceBook communities. Ultimately, treat your community like a close friend....
item.content:encoded: This was a really fun show I did with Matt Ward and Dan Candell over on the Square Peg Round Hole Podcast. We get to talk about building online communities (in my case Productivity Guild) and how those compare to FaceBook communities. Ultimately, treat your community like a close friend.

item.title: 30: Goals and Fear with Justin DiRose
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Justin DiRose joins Joe and Josh to talk about goals. But they also touch on the difficult topic of fear and how that prevents us from moving forward on our dreams.
item.content:encoded: Justin DiRose joins Joe and Josh to talk about goals. But they also touch on the difficult topic of fear and how that prevents us from moving forward on our dreams.

item.title: 12: The Opposite of What I Needed but Exactly What I Wanted
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe gets a new podcasting setup. Drew talks about his latest experience working with pen and paper. A book sparks a conversation around the future of reading, note-keeping, and the often-discussed subject of input.
item.content:encoded: Joe gets a new podcasting setup. Drew talks about his latest experience working with pen and paper. A book sparks a conversation around the future of reading, note-keeping, and the often-discussed subject of input.

item.title: 29: Welcome to the Productivity Guild Podcast
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Theoretical Accountability is now rebranded to The Productivity Guild Podcast. At the same time, Josh is now losing weight. And Joe is potentially staying solo.
item.content:encoded: Theoretical Accountability is now rebranded to The Productivity Guild Podcast. At the same time, Josh is now losing weight. And Joe is potentially staying solo.

item.title: 11: Paper Works
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: This week Drew and I go into some more depth about paper and why it is becoming a go-to tool for me. Yes, I’m addicted.
item.content:encoded: This week Drew and I go into some more depth about paper and why it is becoming a go-to tool for me. Yes, I’m addicted.

item.title: 28: Analog Podcasting
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh gets fancy with his shaving. He’s also removing peanut butter. Joe likes video calls. Even as a millennial, he prefers the face-to-face meetings. Weird. Oh, and Joe played with OmniPlan.
item.content:encoded: Josh gets fancy with his shaving. He’s also removing peanut butter. Joe likes video calls. Even as a millennial, he prefers the face-to-face meetings. Weird. Oh, and Joe played with OmniPlan.

item.title: 36: Paid to Think by David Goldsmith
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: It’s time to tackle our latest textbook. It was a listener recommendation and has a lot to talk about. So we’re glad this episode didn’t end up being 5 hours long.
item.content:encoded: It’s time to tackle our latest textbook. It was a listener recommendation and has a lot to talk about. So we’re glad this episode didn’t end up being 5 hours long.

item.title: 27: Season 3 Goals
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe is fighting with Office 365. Josh is carrying over goals. And Theoretical Accountability is making some big changes.
item.content:encoded: Joe is fighting with Office 365. Josh is carrying over goals. And Theoretical Accountability is making some big changes.
